summary: This bill, the Permanent Tax Cuts for American Families Act of 2025, proposes to permanently increase the standard deduction under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It specifically amends Section 63(c)(2) to raise the standard deduction amounts for single filers and heads of household, and adjusts for inflation. It also includes a conforming amendment and sets the effective date for the changes to taxable years beginning after the enactment of the Act.
